intro: Pectis pinosia, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has hairy, gray-green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Pectis pinosia is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
